title: How do teachers send letters of recommendation? - Quora

response.answer_text: They follow the directions set out by each school or employer. You, the candidate, will have provided each of your recommenders with the relevant information: Name of the Admissions Professionals or other TargetAddress (snail mail and email)DEADLINE for the recommendationInstructions for sending the recommendation which you have determined by contacting the school or employer.THE JOB description or program nameYour resumeWhy you are interested in this job or program and how the recommender might support your candidacy If the recommender’s secretary or assistant will be producing these letters, you will SPECIFICALLY AND PERSONALLY thank that person. Yes. Apparently a lot of work. But it’s for your own career. If you won’t do this prep work, it is presumptuous to ask someone else to do it for you.

If it is the Common Application, you send the teacher an invitation (AFTER talking to them) to submit a recommendation on your behalf. Same process for any state sponsored common application procedure. If they do not use that, they would submit a copy to your guidance office for printing on school letter head and that would be mailed to the college separately.
